explanation: init_rand_data has no formal parameters, so the MISRA rule about modifying a function parameter can only be violated if an identifier used in the function is actually a parameter (e.g. via a macro or unusual declaration). To be certain, the only symbol that must be checked is rand_data — verify its declaration to confirm it is a global/object and not a hidden parameter. All other identifiers (open, read, close, fprintf, strerror, errno, CryptGenRandom, etc.) are library calls or globals and do not affect whether init_rand_data modifies one of its own function parameters (there are none).
